thread.title: Tennis-Record-setter Nadal roars back as Spain draw level against Germany

title: Tennis-Record-setter Nadal roars back as Spain draw level against Germany
text:
April 6, 2018 / 3:42 PM / Updated 4 hours ago Record-setter Nadal roars back as Spain draw level against Germany Zoran Milosavljevic 3 Min Read 
  Tennis - Davis Cup - Quarter Final - Spain vs Germany - Plaza de Toros de Valencia, Valencia, Spain - April 6, 2018 Spain's Rafael Nadal celebrates winning his quarter final match against Germany's Philipp Kohlschreiber REUTERS/Heino Kalis 
 times   went 1-0 up against Italy after Lucas Pouille overpowered Andreas Seppi 6-3 6-2 4-6 3-6 6-1 and Croatia also took the lead against Kazakhstan as Marin Cilic brushed aside Dmitry Popko 6-2 6-1 6-2. Tennis - Davis Cup - Quarter Final - Spain vs Germany - Plaza de Toros de Valencia, Valencia, Spain - April 6, 2018 Spain's Rafael Nadal celebrates winning his quarter final match against Germany's Philipp Kohlschreiber REUTERS/Heino Kalis 
Nadal was swiftly back into   lop-sided contest. Slideshow (4 Images) 
Kohlschreiber also went down tamely in the second before putting up more of a fight at the start of the third, but 16-times grand slam winner Nadal kept his foot on the gas and wrapped up the match in two hours and 33 minutes. 
  
It seemed plain sailing for Pouille in Genoa after he swept aside Seppi in the opening two sets but the slugfest went the distance after the Italian fought back in front of a passionate home crowd. 
Cilic had an easier task in Croatia’s Adriatic resort of Umag, as he breezed past Popko to put the competition’s 2005 winners in the driving seat. 
  Writing by Zoran Milosavljevic in Belgrade; Editng by Toby Davis
